definitions.definition: to prepare food by heating it, for example by boiling, baking or frying it
definitions.sensetop: cook somethingcook something for somebodycook somebody something
definitions.labels: (especially British English)(British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(especially North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: Where did you learn to cook?
Add the onion and cook for three minutes.
What's the best way to cook trout?
I always have a **cooked breakfast** *(= consisting of cooked food)*
I'll cook you a special meal for your birthday.
Make sure you cook the meat well.
Ensure that the meat is cooked through.
the smell of freshly cooked bacon

definitions.definition: to be prepared by boiling, baking, frying, etc.

examples.text: While the pasta is cooking, prepare the sauce.
Turn the fish over so that it cooks evenly.
Everyone is being very secretive—there's something cooking.

definitions.definition: to be doing something very well and successfully
to change facts or figures dishonestly or illegally

examples.text: His accountant had been cooking the books for years.

definitions.definition: to destroy somebody’s chances of success

wordOrigin: Old English cōc (noun), from popular Latin cocus, from Latin coquus.
